text: Th2-biased immunogenicity of stimulated cpdm BMDC

The defective IL12 production ( Fig . 3A ) and Th2-dominant cytokine profile in cpdm mice [ 5 ] suggest that the absence of <extra_id_0> SHARPIN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> affects the ability of cpdm BMDC to induce T cell differentiation into effector cells .

Co-culture of allogeneic naive CD4+ T cells with WT BMDC stimulated with LPS or poly I : C elicited robust <extra_id_0> IFNgamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production , whereas the concentration of <extra_id_0> IFNgamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in cpdm BMDC-T cell cultures was significantly lower after LPS stimulation ( Fig . 7A ) , indicating impaired Th1-polarizing abilities of cpdm BMDC .

text: In addition to <extra_id_0> TLR3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> agonists , the <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligand <extra_id_0> Pam3CYS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was used since it has been shown to induce both Th1 and Th2 responses [ 28 ] - [ 30 ] .

text: The reduced Th1 differentiation following <extra_id_0> Pam3CYS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation is consistent with the recent report of decreased IL12 production in cpdm macrophages following <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation [ 31 ] .

In contrast , more Th2 - specific <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cytokine was produced in the cpdm BMDC co-cultures than the WT control ( Fig . 7B ) , suggesting Th2-skewed immunogenicity of cpdm BMDC .

The production of Th17 - specific cytokine <extra_id_0> IL17A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> following LPS stimulation of dendritic cells was similar between stimulated WT and cpdm BMDC cocultures ( data not shown ) .

text: Despite the distinct Th1 - and Th2-stimulating abilities of WT and cpdm BMDC , they were equally effective in <extra_id_0> IL2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production from BMDC-T cell co-cultures except for poly I : C stimulation where WT BMDC induced more <extra_id_0> IL2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> than cpdm BMDC ( Fig . 7C ) .

text: The Th2-biased stimulating capability of cpdm BMDC when co-cultured with allogeneic naive CD4+ T cells is consistent with the Th2-dominant cytokine phenotype observed in cpdm mice .
